storyName: Where the Land and a Fragment Belong
storyInfo: Rhodes Island begins a long rebuilding process, while Mon3tr continues to search for a way to bring Kal'tsit back. The Cautus who should have disintegrated and died returns to Terra, bringing changes beyond her wildest imagination.

attributes.name: Medic Operator
attributes.content: The auditorium is...

attributes.name: Medic Operator
attributes.content: Huh? Is this not the place?
attributes.joined: The auditorium is... Huh? Is this not the place?

attributes.content: You're back too?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Voice

attributes.content: The auditorium is this way. Follow me!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I came back as soon as I got word from the Messenger.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: So many people... it's like everybody's back...
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: The internal layout is being continuously improved, but people still get lost all the time.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: We're going to put some signs up.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I couldn't believe it when I first heard that HQ was being moved to a nomadic plate... didn't have the access level to find out what exactly happened in the incident.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: All I heard is something about Originium, and that the ship was abandoned and everyone was evacuated.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: No need to worry. Like the Doctor said, we'll dig the old ship out.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Uh-huh... I saw Amiya on my way here. I asked about Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: She didn't go into details, only told me not to worry—
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Before I got the chance to comfort her.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: Red still harbors hope.
She is hiding in the shadows in a corner, the bag holding her baby tooth in her pocket.
Red wanted to sneak it into Kal'tsit's pocket when she came back, but it was someone else who did.
She wants to hear about Kal'tsit today. She knows that the Doctor and Mon3tr have been working on something in secret.
Uh... Dr. Warfarin? I thought it was the Doctor's presentation.
attributes.name: Medic Operator

attributes.content: No need to look so nervous.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I'm simply here to give a talk on a paper. Medical Department's routine.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Dr. {@nickname} is currently busy with something else, and there is no one more suited than I.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: This paper was co-authored by one of my patients, by the name of Chloe.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: In the recent incident on Rhodes Island, she helped us complete a critical piece of Oripathy research.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Not only did this research turn the tides at the time, it also provides guidance for every medical worker with an interest in Oripathy moving forward.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Usually, this is the time when I talk about the authors, their biographies, their achievements...
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: When it comes to Chloe, however, I'm not sure where to start.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Her resume is largely a blank sheet. To be honest, I hardly took any interest in her past in the three years that I cared for her.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: I left only a few comments in her file—
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Oripathy patient from Victoria. Not always diligent about following doctor's instructions. Makes atrocious noises in the ward with her handmade clocks...
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: She was the one who proposed the key hypothesis of the experiment, and the one who provided a precious sample.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: The sample was herself.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: She asked me to harm her, in order to obtain more accurate data from the objective changes that occurred to her.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Few of the operators at the presentation have ever seen Dr. Warfarin so serious.
More than a few thought about sneaking out quietly at first, when they found out that she was the one presenting.
At the end, however, they all stayed, out of respect to Chloe's sacrifice, and because they all wanted to know what exactly happened to Rhodes Island.
As her doctor, I could not approve of her choice.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: As a member of Rhodes Island, however, I am indebted to her courage—
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.text: 'Her condition was unusual, special. Perhaps she had a chance to escape the despair of Oripathy, to live on in another way.'

attributes.content: I-I've made my choice.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: You want to go back to the land that belonged to you?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: You know what this means. You will face death once again.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Death has always been the conclusion to life.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: In this place, I've seen so many 'gods' that I could not even fathom, and learned so much from them.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I want to go back and tell my people...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The end may be destined, but they need not live in fear of death and disintegration.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Perhaps I can soothe the fear that Originium brings them.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Is this all you want?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The Cautus looks at Priestess with firm eyes. The miracle maker takes her hand.
Come with me, then.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I will take you home.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Is there anything here that you will miss?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The Cautus shakes her head.
Will I ever see you again?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I'm not a prophet. I can't see your future.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Priestess takes the Cautus's hand, and they walk into the shadow of the megastructure.
They walk towards the silent conclusion of countless civilizations, the cradle of new hope.

attributes.text: '...Our joint research has validated a key conclusion.'
'A change is occurring to Originium, the nature of which we have yet to ascertain. It has already had a chain effect on our patients.'
'We have empirically demonstrated the existence of new symptoms of Oripathy for the first time since the large-scale infection incident in Victoria three years ago.'
'This will take Terra's Oripathy research into a new direction. Whether this is for the better or for the worse remains to be seen, as we continue to accumulate case studies and data.'

attributes.content: The Cautus smells wind and sand as her eyes adjust to the light.
There is no doubt about it. This is her Terra. She is home.
She can still feel the warmth in her hand, but she is alone.
You're gone...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I can't believe there's someone else in this forsaken place—
attributes.name: Voice from Far Away

attributes.content: ...seek help from her... she looks even weaker than us...
attributes.name: Voice from Far Away

attributes.content: I know it hurts... I'll find help... wait for me... hang in there...
attributes.name: Voice from Far Away

attributes.content: The Cautus sees someone run towards her frantically.
H-Hello, could you contact the nearest hospital—no, it would be too late—
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: Would you happen to have any suppressants? It looks like you're Infected too...
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: The miner grabs Hierda's hand like a drowning man grasps at a straw.
She does not have any suppressants, nor does she know how to contact the nearest hospital.
But she does not want to take hope away from her brethren.
Is there any trouble? You can take me there.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Maybe I can help.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Maybe.
Thank you! Thank you so much!
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: My brother's over there!
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: Hierda is stunned by what she sees as they hurry around the hills.
A massive Originium crystal is stuck in between the walls of a vast canyon.
Hierda can see something sealed within the crystal.
A ship?
What... is that?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: We found a new vein here, and we wanted to give it a try before we registered it...
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: I mean, look at how rich the color is! Besides, there might be something even more valuable within...
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: But listen, there's something not right with this place! It's like someone's watching us, and my brother got infected from a wound he picked up in an accident—
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: (Screams in pain)
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: It looks really bad. You know as well as I do that he's about to disintegrate... there's nothing that can be done.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I-I can't just leave him here. We have thirteen siblings waiting for us at home—
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: Listen to me. Run, as far away as possible.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: B-But...
attributes.name: Miner

attributes.content: Don't look back. Run.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I've dealt with this before. Leave it to me.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: (Mumbles with great difficulty) Go...
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: I understand your pain. I know the terror that overtakes us when the light fades from our eyes...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I've been there.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: (Mutters in shock)
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: All I can do is walk with you to the end.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The Cautus holds the hardened hand of the dying, trying to give him one last sliver of warmth.
May your pain be eased, even just a little.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: My pain... it-it's gone!
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: The Cautus does not understand what happened—The rocks are still spreading on the body of the dying.
But the color of the black rocks becomes increasingly pure, and they begin to glow orange.
H-How did you do that?!
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: They don't hurt any more. Why...?
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: The shocked man tries to move, and finds that movement comes naturally, as though the accident never happened.
Except for the Originium that continues to grow.
Perhaps there will come a day when it replaces his flesh and blood in its entirety.
What will become of him when that day comes?
I feel myself recovering. This is amazing...
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: H-Have I been freed from death?
attributes.name: Infected Worker

attributes.content: He looks at the Cautus girl, only to see the same shocked expression in her eyes.
—Did you grant my wish? Or is it...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: She does not see the one she wants to see, but catches a glimpse of a figure on a distant peak, gazing at them.
The figure turns around and leaves.
—This paper means a lot to me personally.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Chloe's efforts reminded me why Rhodes Island exists, and why Kal'tsit is committed to our path.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Unlike any period in its history, Rhodes Island today is not only a pharmaceutical company that fights the pain brought about by Oripathy—
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: It must deal with the Originium problem at the source too.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: We brought hope to those who had lost it. In turn, they repay us with hope.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: This paper is Rhodes Island's salute to Chloe, and a promise on our part—
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: —A promise to Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: You arrive after Warfarin's speech has concluded.

attributes.options: Thank you for doing the presentation on my behalf.
She was a patient who saved her doctor.

attributes.content: You look happy. Are you done on your end?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Yes, Dr. Warfarin.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: With Mon3tr's help, we managed to identify some key pieces of information in the vast amounts of data that Dr. Kal'tsit left behind.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: You mean...?!
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: Dr. Warfarin! I found a way!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: My connection to her was severed, but her bio-identification signals and neuron data are still stored inside my brain.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Plus the neural network I had shared with her, in theory, all we'll need is a life support device powerful enough to—
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Slow down, slow down! What exactly are you getting at?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: What I mean is, although it's a purely theoretical possibility...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: By using the power of the Sarcophagus...
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: We can bring Kal'tsit back!
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: I knew Kal'tsit wouldn't go so easily...
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.content: But the Sarcophagus? The one that was on Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Warfarin

attributes.options: We can't go back to Rhodes Island for a while.;There is only one other Sarcophagus accessible to us.

attributes.content: It's like we've come full circle.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: This will not be easy. Ursus remains a dangerous place for Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: But Kal'tsit has planned ahead and made arrangements at all our branches across Terra. Our first priority should be to restore communications with them.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: We'll need their help for what we're trying to do.
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.options: We'll make contact with Ursus first.
Then, we'll find a way to bring Kal'tsit back.

attributes.content: So this is what Terra looks like now.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: 'Kolossal Prime Vein'? That's what they're calling that piece of Originium these days?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Hmm. Maybe it'll be a good choice for the next step.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The rate of Originium propagation is far below expected values, and AMa-10 has been a significant hindrance.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The project must be accelerated. Time is short.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The evolution of this planet is taking place too slowly.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: More radical means are called for—
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: She walks deeper into the Abyss, now sealed in Originium.
...Looks like connection by PRTS won't be possible for now.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Perhaps—
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.text: You don't know what you're doing, Dr. {@nickname}...
\n\nIt's unfortunate that you have forgotten everything, our explorations of space, the shared pins that anchor our thoughts, and the 'debate' that has lasted so many millennia...
\n\nAnd your very first promise to me...
Time, the most cruel of mazes. It leads us astray, and separates us from each other.
\n\nBut I believe, I've always believed, that you will once again recognize the truth of this universe, and our inevitable end.
\n\nI believe that you will come back to me when that time comes.

attributes.content: You've led us on a long walk, Sankta.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Have you decided to become a bounty hunter too?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: You talk too much, Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Your fate was sealed the moment you decided to attack that innocent Siracusan caravan.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: But it was too close to the Kazdelian border. His Holiness has encouraged upholding justice through proper means, to maintain peace on the surface, and it was not my place to go against the rules.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: This place will do.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You're too far from home, mercenary.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You should have stayed in Kazdel, and never came out of that pit of yours.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Oren raises his gun.
...You missed?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: You—you—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: My hand should not be trembling.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Yes, you should fear me, Sarkaz. It's over.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Wait! Wait—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: M-Monster! What are you?!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Mercenary

attributes.content: Oren takes a questioning look at his gun, and sees a shocking sight in the reflection of the gleaming metal.
His halo flashes frantically above his head.
Dazed and confused, he looks at his reflection again, and the devil that he is about to execute—
They look exactly the same.
